alert.note: Alert for Josephine (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued August 08 at 2:21PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT TUESDAY... Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has issued an air quality advisory for southern Josephine County...in effect until 11 PM PDT Tuesday. DEQ expects the air quality advisory to last until at least Tuesday, Aug. 9. DEQ and partner agencies will continue to monitor smoke in the area. Smoke levels can change rapidly depending on weather. Check current conditions on the Oregon Smoke Information Blog, DEQ’s Air Quality Index, or by downloading the free OregonAIR app on your smartphone. Smoke can irritate the eyes and lungs and worsen some medical conditions. People most at risk include infants and young children, people with heart or lung disease, older adults and pregnant people. Protect yourself and your family when smoke levels are high: Stay inside if possible. Keep windows and doors closed. If it’s too hot, run air conditioning on recirculate or consider moving to a cooler location. Avoid strenuous outdoor activity. Use a high efficiency particulate air filter in indoor ventilation systems or portable air purifiers. Be aware of smoke in your area and avoid places with the highest levels. For additional information...please visit the web site at http://www.oregon.gov/deq
